Description: A sherd from the shoulder of a large amphora, with a mark on the exterior. The mark was made during production. The pottery fabric is a highly micaceous red clay with inclusions of limestone grit. The exterior is a pale red-brown.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 27
Curator's comments: Bibliography: see also Johnston in Villing, A. and Schlotzhauer, U. (eds), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt, BM Research Publication 162, London., p. 28, Table 1, no. 7.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 1) (fragment from 27)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.128, p.209, p.225, pl.67)
